title: Tips on notetaking CS 3rd sem
content:
I tried making hands on notes in  class, but during exams I just ended up studying from slides...Is there actually any good reasons to make notes in class, Should I make notes when I self-study or just fuck notes and just study from slides...Are there any individual subjects that I need to focus on from early on itself ?

  
**Any help in this would be greatly appreciated**

comments.body:
It depends on the person and the subject. Notes can be helpful for math (whatever the subject is) and AFLL.

If you can neatly write down the procedure to solve an AFLL question and make note of some questions, it can be helpful. So, try to make running notes during classes for SDS and AFLL. Not in detail, ignore theory. Just the procedures and some formulae that are not in slides would be sufficient.

As for subjects to focus on, it depends on what you find easy and hard. DSA is the most important subject. Spend a good amount of time on it, as it is helpful for placements. Try solving questions after you complete a concept.

Web Tech is also important. Spend a good amount of time on it, go beyond academics, and try things hands-on, as you'll have to make projects by yourself for your resume.

SDS is easy. Just classwork questions and slides should be enough.

AFLL is similar.

DDCO can be a little tough. Study things from the text and solve textbook questions.
